This is an archive of presentation decks and instructional material from previous classes I have taught.

Because the SCA requires instructors to develop their own instructional material, I might not have included all of the slides or images that were presented in a given class.

While I try to ensure that the slides aren’t the primary source of information, often they are—and that’s a good thing. Reading has positive cognitive consequences. Also, as I’m primarily presenting in situations where English is a second language, the written word helps to clarify what’s being said.

Below are links to class material in reverse chronological order (most-recent first).

If you are taking an SCA Roasting Foundation course, you can use my study guide to get a jump on the class. You may also benefit from reading several of the articles I have organized on my blog.

Want to receive early notification of upcoming classes? Sign up for my newsletter.

You can see if I have any upcoming events on my training page
